column1: Patty well remembered her visit at their summer home which they called the Hurly-Burly
column2: and she could not see that their city residence was any less deserving of the name. Her Aunt Grace and Uncle Ted were jolly
column4: who cared little about system or method in their home. The result was that things often went wrong
column5: but nobody cared especially if they did."I meant to have a nicer luncheon for you
column7: said her aunt, as they sat down at the table, but the cook forgot to order lobsters
column8: and when I telephoned for fresh peas the grocer said I was too late
column9: for they were all sold. I'm so sorry
column10: for I do love hothouse peas
column11: don't you?""I don't care what I have to eat
column12: Aunt Grace. I just came to visit you people
column14: and the luncheon doesn't matter a bit."
